basic.floral_language:
Viburnum lantana 
Floriography: beautiful, fortune, perseverant
Viburnum lantana is a deciduous shrub with grayish green, broadly ovate leaves covered by small hairs. Flowers nearly hemispherical shape, cute and exquisite, in flowering seasons, the plant is covered by numerous vigorous and vivid flowers. Often used as ornamental flowers and trees for landscaping or home decoration.
Viburnum lantana likes sunshine, also shade-tolerant. Flowers in May-June for 1-2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-June, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like light, but also resistant to half shade
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
